title: Blended Learning Design for East Asian Music Education: Competency-Enhancement Program for High School Students

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Music Theory and Instrument Performance Experience
context.additional_context: A blended course conducted in a smartphone-based limited technology environment, integrating theoretical learning and hands-on practice.

learning_goals: The difference in achievement of Eastern music competency between the experimental and control groups is statistically validated.
A student-centered objectivist-constructivist integrated teaching method is applied in a blended learning environment.
Creative expression skills are enhanced through digital content creation and sharing activities using smartphones.
The effectiveness of blended classes compared to traditional learning methods is demonstrated with quantitative data.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
